data.question: What are the names of the first heterobimetallic triple-stranded helicates synthesized as described in the text?
data.answer: (PNP)4[TiMo(1)3] (2 a) and Li1.5Na0.5(PNP)2[TiMo(1)3] (2 b)

data.question: What ligand is used for the selective assembly of heterobimetallic helical complexes?
data.answer: Directional benzene-o-dithiol/catechol ligand H4-1

data.question: What is the role of Li+, Na+, and PNP+ cations in the synthesis of heterobimetallic triple-stranded helicates?
data.answer: They influence the configuration and coordination mode of the {TiIVO6} and {MoIVS6} polyhedra in the complexes.

data.question: How does the electronic feature of benzene-o-dithiolato donor group compare to the catecholato group?
data.answer: The electronic features of the benzene-o-dithiolato donor group are clearly different from those of the catecholato group.

data.question: What is the significance of the helical twist between the two L-configured metal centers in [TiMo(1)3]4-?
data.answer: The helical twist measures 42.68, indicating the spatial arrangement and interaction between the metal centers.

data.question: What type of hydrogen bonds are observed for the first time in the [TiMo(1)3)]4- anions?
data.answer: N-H···O and N-H···S hydrogen bonds are observed for the first time in the [TiMo(1)3)]4- anions.

data.question: What is the effect of the different binding preferences of the donor groups on the orientation of the ligand strands?
data.answer: The different binding preferences of the donor groups for the two metal ions lead to a parallel orientation of the ligand strands.

data.question: How does the presence of alkali metal cations influence the aggregation of dinuclear triple-stranded helicates?
data.answer: The aggregation of helicates of type [TiMo(1)3]4- is controlled by the nature and number of available alkali metal cations.

data.question: Why are N-H···S hydrogen bonds not formed in dinuclear triple-stranded titanium helicates?
data.answer: The folding of the {TiIV(bdt)} unit along the S···S-vector prevents the formation of N-H···S hydrogen bonds in dinuclear triple-stranded titanium helicates.

data.question: What leads to the formation of strong N-H···O and N-H···S hydrogen bonds in the synthesized complexes?
data.answer: The planar geometry of the {MoIV(bdt)} moiety and the different geometric parameters in {TiIV(bdt)3} and {MoIV(bdt)3} polyhedra lead to the formation of strong N-H···O and N-H···S hydrogen bonds.

data.question: How does the reaction of H4-1 with MoIV and TiIV result in heterobimetallic triple-stranded helicates?
data.answer: The directional ligand H4-1 reacts with MoIV and TiIV to give heterobimetallic triple-stranded helicates with a parallel orientation of the ligand strands due to the different binding preferences.

data.question: What determines the aggregation of the helical anions in the solid state for the complexes?
data.answer: The aggregation of the helical anions in the solid state is determined by the nature of the cations and their interactions with the polyhedra.

data.question: Is the electronic feature of the benzene-o-dithiolato donor group similar to the catecholato group?
data.answer: False, the electronic features of the benzene-o-dithiolato donor group are clearly different from those of the catecholato group.

data.question: Do the {Ti(cat)3} polyhedra in the complexes always adopt a trigonal-prismatic coordination geometry?
data.answer: False, the {Ti(cat)3} polyhedra in such complexes adopt an octahedral coordination geometry.

data.question: Are N-H···S hydrogen bonds commonly observed in homobimetallic titanium complexes with directional benzene-o-dithiolato/catecholato ligands?
data.answer: False, only N-H···O hydrogen bonds have been observed in homobimetallic titanium complexes with directional benzene-o-dithiolato/catecholato ligands.

data.question: Is the self-assembly of dinuclear triple-stranded helicates from three bis(benzene-o-dithiolato) ligands and two titanium(IV) ions a common occurrence?
data.answer: True, the self-assembly of dinuclear triple-stranded helicates from three bis(benzene-o-dithiolato) ligands and two titanium(IV) ions has been reported.

data.question: Does the addition of four equivalents of (PNP)Cl always lead to insoluble (PNP)4[TiMo(1)3] (2 a)?
data.answer: False, the addition of only two equivalents of (PNP)Cl leads to Li1.5Na0.5(PNP)2[TiMo(1)3] (2 b), which is soluble in methanol.

data.question: Is the C3-symmetry preserved for the helical anion of 2 b?
data.answer: False, the C3-symmetry is not preserved for the helical anion of 2 b due to the coordination of lithium cations in a bridging fashion.

data.question: Can the {MIV(bdt)3} polyhedra in helicates such as 2 a and 2 b be oxidized to give trigonal-prismatic MoVI species under loss of helicity?
data.answer: True, future experiments are designed to reveal whether the {MIV(bdt)3} polyhedra in helicates such as 2 a and 2 b can be oxidized to give trigonal-prismatic MoVI species under loss of helicity.

data.question: Are the helical anions of type [TiMo(1)3]4- formed as a pair of racemic L,L and D,D stereoisomers?
data.answer: True, the helical anions of type [TiMo(1)3]4- are formed as a pair of racemic L,L and D,D stereoisomers.
